data.title: Dont crash when Documents\OpenRA is hidden
data.body:
It fixes the hidden openra folder crash.

I decided to put a warning on console to the User!

Problems when the openRA runs readonly:
- no settings will be written
- no Log files will be created
- Map editor is not functiontional

Tested so far: when Documents\OpenRA is HIDDEN
-> Download and installing content works as expected
-> Settings and Logs are not written
-> Screenshots will be saved correctly (the files are not hidden)

data.body:
Fixes #9063.
Fixes #9127.

data.title: Windows 10 video driver reset
data.body:
When windows 10 resets the video driver (detects an issue or crash) OpenRA does not reset the device. The sound, game goes on, but the rendering is totally frozen, no mouse, nothing. I can alt tab all works, just the game is frozen. I can press escape hear the sound of the menu etc.  It doesn't reset the rendering device when needed.

In DirectX it's reset device, but I don't know for OpenRA.

Thanks for looking into this.

data.title: Minor Production trait cleanups.
data.body: Fixes a handful of minor nits that were missed in #8979.

data.title: Fix capitalisation of the "Explored Map" option.
data.body: Fixes a silly polish regression that shouldn't have made it through review.

data.title: Fix visibility queries when fog is disabled.
data.body: Fixes #9037.

data.title: Empty "Protected" servers do not show up
data.body:
Empty "Protected" servers only show up when "Waiting" + "Empty" are also selected.
If either one isn't selected they don't show up.

data.title: Consider adding new track to RA mod (title music)
data.body:
There was this gentleman called sbeast on the forums some time ago offering his track to be used with OpenRA: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=17379&highlight=

mediafire: http://www.mediafire.com/listen/ic1ieq1lkl8p7dp/OpenRA.mp3

I found out he has a YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/sbeast64

What I like about this track (Hell March cover), in addition to being really good is that it's style fits well with the c&c soundtrack. The track is being offered freely. The appeal could be to reinforce the uniqueness of OpenRA's RA mod and the nature of it's voluntaryism. It could also encourage getting more valuable free offers from songwriters. Imagine having equally good, or better, unique tracks for all the mods (title music). If feasable, I feel this would be worthy of consideration.

data.title: TD: rename "v37" civilian building?
data.body:
According to http://nyerguds.arsaneus-design.com/N64Project/editing/cut_stuff.txt

> Civilian Building "The Studio" [V37]
> Is unused in PC C&C; represents the Westwood Studios building

According to http://www.giantbomb.com/westwood-studios-inc/3010-261/ Westwood Studios was located at 5333 South Arville, Suite 104, Las Vegas (which may be a PO box?), but google maps/earth shows a similar building there: https://www.google.com/maps/place/36%C2%B005'34.9%22N+115%C2%B011'59.2%22W/@36.093025,-115.199777,228m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x0

edit:
currently it is called:
- Civilian Building

but maybe this would be more accurate:
- Westwood Studios Building
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25759975-td-rename-v37-civilian-building?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: "No suitable renderers were found" on windows
data.body:
Hello,

I have 2 computers
On both of them, OpenRA won't launch because it doesn't detect opengl 2.0 (like in the issue #7622)

1) do you know how could I fix this ?

2) do you think implementing a OpenGL to DirectX wrapper is doable ?
https://gl2dx.codeplex.com/

A) is ASUS G1S laptop with nvidia 8600M GT
OS is windows vista sp1
installed drivers for graphic card is 307.83 from 01/2013

it is weird because I used to run OpenRA like a year ago, and condiguration has not been change since (don't know the version of openra though since files deleted..)

exception.log :

```
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.0.6001 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.235
```

data.title: settings.yaml is conflicting when running multiple servers on same users
data.body:
I'm having some issues with running multiple servers on same users (Linux verified).

It seems on start the server writes the settings to settings.yaml in .openra/ directory.

Earlier I've noticed a problem where the server name could actually be affected by this and duplicate, if the servers started up too fast (Sorted with adding a sleep in the script) - But I've experienced another "worse" problem now.

Even though I'm starting my servers first, without any Server.Password, if I then start other servers, on the same user, but with Server.Password parameter, the first servers too, get locked (I guess it re-reads settings.yaml every now and then, and finds the Password-parameter).

Is there any way to create a settings.yaml per server? Maybe settings-$PID.yaml if it's easy to get the PID on all OS'es.

It's very "time consuming/waste" to create own user for every server you might want to change the settings on.

Hope there's a solution to a more multi-setup friendly environment :)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25757690-settings-yaml-is-conflicting-when-running-multiple-servers-on-same-users?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Convert AttackGarrisoned, AttackTurreted, etc into separate traits for an Attacks trait
Hide-map effect does not work in replays
data.body:
The hide-map effect of crates doesn't work in replays, meaning the scouted area merely remains hidden behind fog of war, not newly created shroud as it should.

Here's a replay and a map (provided by Zjordy):
http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=59247814826002024943

data.title: TD: renames tooltip on "Defence" tab to "Support"
data.body: as suggested by GraionDilach in #9047

data.title: Actor sight range has a hardcoded upper limit
data.body:
As revealed in #9053.
Actor sight range is limited by the size of `Map.TilesByDistance`, which is defined as
`static readonly CVec[][] TilesByDistance = InitTilesByDistance(MaxTilesInCircleRange);`.
This means that it is calculated once at game start and is the same for all maps.
`Map.MaxTilesInCircleRange` is defined as `public const int MaxTilesInCircleRange = 50;`, which means there is effectively a hardcoded upper limit on the sight range one can put on an actor.

To be fair, `TilesByDistance`, which is used in `Map.FindTilesInAnnulus()` (only), is used for all kinds of stuff other than visibility as well, which means there is an upper limit of 50 cells for quite a few things.

_P.S.: The actual limit for visibility is currently 49, because of_

```
public static IEnumerable<PPos> ProjectedCellsInRange(Map map, WPos pos, WDist range)
{
    // Account for potential extra half-cell from odd-height terrain
```

This can easily be changed to account for each map's size and adjust accordingly. That can be coupled with lint checks that would give proper warnings to modders and mappers about ranges that are too big. (there comes a point when the range is too big for the map).

data.title: Add a InitialSpawnDelay to CrateSpawner
data.body: Fixes #9055.

data.title: RenderSptrites: Scale does not affect death animations
data.body:
When using the scale trait of RenderSprites, the death animation is not affected at all.

http://i.imgur.com/oQPSXSv.gif

data.title: Reduce allocations in the main game loop
data.body:
- Cache the shroud projection even for flat maps to avoid allocating single element arrays.
- Avoid LINQ in shroud and map projection queries to avoid enumerator allocations.
- Avoid LINQ in calculation of sync values.
- Cache enumerables in ProductionQueue.

Mostly straightforward, but if testing, I would double-check I didn't break the shroud on both the rectangular and isometric maps.

Overall, this reduces allocation in the main game loop by about 20%.

data.title: Fixed a likely null reference exception when checking mod sequence definitions
data.body: Detected by Coverity.

data.title: Build queue provider without ProvidesPrerequisite starts with all available build options disabled
data.body:
Tested this out with a mobile war factory using `ProductionQueue`. I assume this is intended, though but then document it.

Example setup:

``` yaml
gamwrf:
    Production:
        Produces: Hanomag
    ProductionQueue@Vehicle:
        Type: Hanomag
        Group: Vehicle
        BuildSpeed: .333
        LowPowerSlowdown: 2

#Does not use explicit prerequisite, using the queue as such
hntnk:
    Buildable:  
        Queue: Hanomag
```

Without `ProvidesPrerequisite` on `gamwrf`, the queue stays disabled until the first such recheck, even though the new queue appears and `hntnk` pops up on it.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25725049-build-queue-provider-without-providesprerequisite-starts-with-all-available-build-options-disabled?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Delay for CrateSpawner
data.body:
I understand that the unit duplication crate has been removed from all mods (which is needed). However I think this is just a bandaid. 

In the first 5 minutes of any mod, 1v1 especially, are critical. Crates really mess up games in these first 5 minutes. Unit dupe crates are the worst, then light tank crates in RA (light tank husk blocking REF or WF) then money crates. Even death crates are annoying as early map control and LoS is paramount. 

This is especially true on very small 1v1 maps.

data.title: Merge Plane and Helicopter traits
data.body:
First steps toward having a single aircraft type that can handle different situations.
Ultimate goals are:
- Provide modders with as much flexibility regarding aircraft as possible.
- Reduce the 10 traits and 15 activities we currently have to a sensible number.
- Fix some aircraft issues along the way.

This PR merges `Plane` and `Helicopter` into their base `Aircraft` trait.
It does some cleanup on `Aircraft` as well, and some minor side cleanups along the way.
The last commit also fixes an issue currently present on bleed.

While the commits here aren't as good (self-contained) as I want them, I do suggest reviewing by commit.
Ingame result should be that nothing changes behavior-wise (apart from the bugfix from the last commit). It's all pretty easy to test, actually.

data.title: Fix a crash in dropzone-w
data.body:
We don't need RevealsShroud here anyway, as the map disabled Shroud and Fog.

Fixes the following crash:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside of the array. (Der Index war außerhalb des Arraybereichs.)
   at OpenRA.Map.<FindTilesInAnnulus>d__26.MoveNext() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Map\Map.cs:Line 1177.
   at OpenRA.Traits.Shroud.<ProjectedCellsInRange>d__0.MoveNext() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Traits\World\Shroud.cs:Line 86.
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<SelectManyIterator>d__14`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.<DistinctIterator>d__81`1.MoveNext()
   at System.Linq.Buffer`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 source)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToArray[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.RevealsShroud.ProjectedCells(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.RevealsShroud.AddedToWorld(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.Add(Actor a) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 225.
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(Boolean addToWorld, String name, TypeDictionary initDict) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 214.
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 205.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.SpawnMapActors.WorldLoaded(World world, WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.World.LoadComplete(WorldRenderer wr) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\World.cs:Line 191.
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 155.
   at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder(OrderManager orderManager, World world, Int32 clientId, Order order) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Network\UnitOrders.cs:Line 110.
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Network\OrderManager.cs:Line 130.
   at OpenRA.Sync.<>c__DisplayClass5.<CheckSyncUnchanged>b__4() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:Line 170.
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:Line 178.
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:Line 170.
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 462.
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 507.
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 631.
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Line 671.
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 111.
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Line 39.
```

The range was probably too high.

data.title: Increase ShippedSoundtracks of the TD mod.
data.body:
Fixes #9043.

I broke this with my first music PR actually. >_>
